body_content.explanation: to take something without the permission or knowledge of the owner and keep it:
examples: She admitted stealing the money from her employers.
The number of cars which are stolen every year has risen.
They were so poor they had to steal in order to eat.

body_content.explanation: to do something quickly or without being noticed:
examples: She stole a glance at her watch.
He stole out of the room while no one was looking.

body_content.explanation: In baseball, if you steal a base, you run from one of the bases (= positions on a square that a player must reach to score a point) to the next one while the pitcher is throwing the ball, and reach the base before an opponent can touch you with the ball:
examples: He is not a fast runner and has not stolen a base all year.

body_content.explanation: In sports such as basketball, rugby, and football, to take the ball from an opponent:
examples: Thomas stole the ball and ran the length of the field to score.
She stole the ball in the tackle and fed her fly-half.

body_content.explanation: a product that has a very low price, or a price that is much lower than the original cost:
examples: I picked up a new iron in the sale - it was a steal.
